when two different glaciers merge and the lateral moraines of each coalesce to form a moraine in the middle of the combined glacier

qas.question: What are ground moraines also called?
What are no longer visable after a glacier retreats?
What type of moraines are formed at the begining of the glacier?
What mraines are formed when two ice sheets meet?
What blankets the surface of a glacier?
What are upslope from the equilibrium line?

context: <b5_0>Glacial moraines<b5_0/> are formed by the <a1_0>deposition of material from a glacier<a1_0/> and are exposed <a0_0>after the glacier has retreated<a0_0/>. They usually appear as linear mounds of till, a non-sorted mixture of rock, gravel and boulders within a matrix of a fine powdery material. <b6_0>Terminal or end moraines<b6_0/> are formed at the foot or terminal end of a glacier. Lateral moraines are formed on the <a2_0>sides of the glacier<a2_0/>. <b7_0>Medial moraines<b7_0/> are formed <a3_0>when two different glaciers merge and the lateral moraines of each coalesce to form a moraine in the middle of the combined glacier<a3_0/>. Less apparent are <b8_0><b9_0>ground moraines<b8_0/>,<b9_0/> also called <a4_0>glacial drift<a4_0/>, which often blankets the surface underneath the glacier downslope from the equilibrium line.
